ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you are interested in using a milling machine, band saw, lathe, CNC machine, and your hands and want to have a really cool miniature steam engine at the end of the semester, take this class. If not, then don't. Pretty simple.
An outstanding introduction to the world of precision machining. Highly recommended.
If the student likes to make things or would like to have machining as a valuable skill, then I can't think of a better way to have an introductory course to machining.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class was necessary to gain access to the machine shops which will be instrumental in making lasers, which are instrumental to my research.
This class did not deepen my knowledge of my discipline or profession but it did make my discipline much more bearable.

This will allow me to construct parts I need for my research projects quickly and safely and has given me a greater understanding of the thinking that can be done to greatly increase the ease of manufacturing of machined parts.

This course allows me to use the machine shop to make my own devices for experiments, saving me and my adviser money and time that would have hadto be spent finding and ordering custom tailored parts.
